materials.raw_text: Nb: 120 g, Si: 160 g, Sm: 10 g, Tb: 70 g

sourcing.instructions: Nb: Purchase from a metallurgical supplier or online specialty metal store. Si: Obtain from a chemical supply company. Sm: Acquire from a rare earth elements supplier. Tb: Source from a rare earth elements supplier.
steps: Nb: Purchase from a metallurgical supplier or online specialty metal store. Si: Obtain from a chemical supply company. Sm: Acquire from a rare earth elements supplier. Tb: Source from a rare earth elements supplier.

1. Measure 120 g of Nb powder. 2. Measure 160 g of Si powder. 3. Measure 10 g of Sm powder. 4. Measure 70 g of Tb powder. 5. Combine all powders in a clean, dry mixing container. 6. Use a mechanical blender or mortar and pestle to thoroughly mix the powders until uniform.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Measure 120 g of Nb powder. 2. Measure 160 g of Si powder. 3. Measure 10 g of Sm powder. 4. Measure 70 g of Tb powder. 5. Combine all powders in a clean, dry mixing container. 6. Use a mechanical blender or mortar and pestle to thoroughly mix the powders until uniform.

steps: 1. Place the mixed powders into a high-temperature furnace. 2. Heat gradually to 1200째C at a rate of 10째C/min. 3. Maintain this temperature for 4 hours to ensure complete reaction.
heating.raw_text: 1. Place the mixed powders into a high-temperature furnace. 2. Heat gradually to 1200째C at a rate of 10째C/min. 3. Maintain this temperature for 4 hours to ensure complete reaction.

steps: 1. Allow the furnace to cool down to room temperature naturally. 2. Ensure the cooling process takes at least 6 hours to avoid thermal shock.
cooling.raw_text: 1. Allow the furnace to cool down to room temperature naturally. 2. Ensure the cooling process takes at least 6 hours to avoid thermal shock.

steps: 1. Once cooled, remove the solid sample from the furnace. 2. Use a diamond saw to cut the sample to the desired dimensions (3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches). 3. Sand the edges and surfaces to achieve a smooth finish. 4. Optionally, apply a protective sealant to enhance durability.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Once cooled, remove the solid sample from the furnace. 2. Use a diamond saw to cut the sample to the desired dimensions (3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches). 3. Sand the edges and surfaces to achieve a smooth finish. 4. Optionally, apply a protective sealant to enhance durability.
